name: lipophilic
content:

Lipophilic substances are attracted to lipids (= fats, oils, or waxes that dissolve in alcohol but not in water and are an important part of living cells): Since the drug is lipophilic, it has been known to persist in the liver and other tissues. These substances accumulate in the human body due to their highly lipophilic properties. Related word
lipid
More examplesFewer examplesDocetaxel is highly lipophilic and practically insoluble in water. Merocyanine540 is a hydrophobic, lipophilic dye that has been shown to stain cell membranes with more intensity if their lipid components are in a high state of disorder.
